title: How to Apply for a Job at Target

steps.title: Go to https://corporate.target.com/careers/.
steps.content: Go to https://corporate.target.com/careers/ . Open your browser to Target's main hiring page instead of their main shopping page. From this main page, you'll be able to search in a variety of ways for open job positions. If you'd like to see a listing of every available Target job, leave the Search All Jobs field blank and click Search. This will give you all of the available positions and you can narrow them down as you like.

steps.title: Pick the state and store location you'd like to work at.
steps.content: Pick the state and store location you'd like to work at. Once you choose the state, you'll see a list of all the stores that are hiring. Then, pick the store you want to work at to see which positions they're hiring for. You can filter the results based on the career area, which includes: [1] X Research source Hourly positions Human resources Marketing and communications Store management

steps.title: Select an application for Target stores or distribution centers.
steps.content: Select an application for Target stores or distribution centers. When you click one of these options, you'll have to verify your age. For example, some jobs require that you're at least 18 years old. Then, to search for jobs under one of these headings, choose the state and location where you'd like to work. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a position to apply for.
steps.content: Choose a position to apply for. Once you've found a position that Target's hiring for, read the job description to see if you're interested in it. Then, read the requirements and job expectations so you know if they'll consider you for the job. [3] X Research source For example, some distribution center positions might require that you're able to lift a heavy load. Human resource positions usually require that you have experience with scheduling and interviewing. If you'd like to be a store manager, you'll need to have a 4-year degree, open availability, and strong communication skills. To help develop products for Target, the company needs you to be able to travel and you should have a background in working with a team.

steps.title: Gather all of the information you need to fill out the application.
steps.content: Gather all of the information you need to fill out the application. In order to sign out and back into the application, provide your social security number, address, and contact information. It's also a good idea to have the contact info for your education or employment references handy.

steps.title: Click Apply Now to start a new application.
steps.content: Click Apply Now to start a new application. Be prepared to spend about 15 minutes filling out the application once you click the Apply Now button. You can make an electronic-signature in order to save the application and sign in later. Keep in mind that you have to finish filling out the application within 96 hours of starting it. You can fill out the online application in English or Spanish.

steps.title: Fill in the details of the application.
steps.content: Fill in the details of the application. After you've given your basic info, you'll need to sign a drug-free workplace agreement and verify that you're legally allowed to work in the U.S. You'll also have to give: Employment history with references Education level and which languages you speak When you can start working Availability for the job you want

steps.title: Review your application for accuracy before you submit it.
steps.content: Review your application for accuracy before you submit it. On the last screen before submitting your application, you'll see all of the information you provided. Read over it carefully to catch any errors in: Personal information Positions you're applying for Educational experience

steps.title: Provide your e-signature and submit the application.
steps.content: Provide your e-signature and submit the application. Enter the same e-signature that you created at the start of the application and press the submit button. You'll see a screen that confirms your application. Target will review your application and it will stay on file for 60 days. If you don't hear anything within 60 days, you can fill out a new application.

steps.title: Accept a seasonal position even if you want a more permanent job.
steps.content: Accept a seasonal position even if you want a more permanent job. If you're trying to get a part-time or full-time job with Target, don't be disappointed if they offer you a seasonal job. Keep in mind that once you're employed with the company, they're more likely to consider you for these permanent positions. When you're offered the job, don't be afraid to ask if the seasonal position could lead to a permanent job.

steps.title: Give Target open availability.
steps.content: Give Target open availability. Try to keep your available schedule as open as possible by listing all the times you could possibly work. Target is more likely to hire you if they know they'll be able to work you into their team's schedule. For example, instead of saying you can only work Tuesdays and Thursdays between 4 and 10, say that you can work all weekday mornings and afternoons.

steps.title: Call Target a few days after submitting your application.
steps.content: Call Target a few days after submitting your application. Wait at least 3 to 4 days after you submit your application and then call the Target location that you applied for. You can ask to speak to the hiring manager. Then, explain that you recently put in an application and were wondering if you could come in for an interview. Mention the job you're trying to get and ask if the position has been filled yet. [4] X Expert Source Lucy Yeh Human Resources Director Expert Interview. 21 November 2019. Touching base with Target shows them that you're truly interested in the job, but avoid calling them more than once or twice.

steps.title: Prepare
steps.content: Prepare for a job interview. If Target calls and wants to set up an interview with you, practice answering some of the questions they may ask you. [5] X Expert Source Lucy Yeh Human Resources Director Expert Interview. 21 November 2019. Questions might include: [6] X Research source Why do you want to work for Target? How would you deal with an upset customer? What do you know about the company? What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses? How have you dealt with a problem in a past job?

steps.title: Pass
steps.content: Pass the job interview. Although you don't need to wear a suit to the interview, wear clean, professional clothes and arrive a few minutes early so your interviewer knows you'd take the job seriously. If you find that you're anxious, take a few calming breaths and try to relax. Try to be conversational and professional as they ask you questions. Avoid bringing drinks or food into the interview since it seems informal and unprofessional. Remember to turn off your phone and wait until after the interview to respond to calls or texts.
